Note: The breakeven stock price range is based on the net debit paid for the spread ($34.78 - $0.09 = $34.69). The range is based on the maximum potential profit and maximum potential loss. The spread will make a profit if the stock price remains below the $340 strike price at expiration. It will make a loss if the stock price rises above the $340 strike price or falls below the $245 strike price.
